name: Electrical Safety Inspection
description: Peace of mind starts with knowing your electrical system is safe. Solomon Electric provides comprehensive electrical safety inspections for South Florida homeowners—examining your panel, wiring, outlets, and connections to identify hidden hazards before they cause fires or shocks. Whether you're buying a home, planning renovations, or simply want assurance that your family is safe, our licensed electricians provide detailed assessments and honest recommendations.
warningSignsHeading: When You Need an Electrical Safety Inspection
warningSignsSubheading: These situations call for professional electrical assessment. Don't wait for problems to become emergencies.

problems.title: Buying or Selling a Home
problems.description: General home inspections barely scratch the surface of electrical safety. A dedicated electrical inspection reveals hidden issues that affect your investment and safety.

problems.title: Home is Over 25 Years Old
problems.description: Electrical systems age invisibly. Wiring insulation degrades, connections loosen, and standards evolve. Older homes often have hidden hazards that need attention.

problems.title: Planning Major Renovations
problems.description: Before investing in renovations, understand your electrical system's condition and capacity. Inspections reveal what upgrades you'll need to support your plans.

problems.title: Insurance Requirements
problems.description: Many insurance companies require electrical inspections for homes with older panels or after claims. We provide documentation that satisfies insurer requirements.

problems.title: Mysterious Electrical Problems
problems.description: Flickering lights, tripping breakers, or warm outlets indicate problems somewhere in your system. Inspections find root causes rather than just treating symptoms.

problems.title: New Homeowner Due Diligence
problems.description: Just moved in? The previous owner may have done DIY electrical work or ignored problems. An inspection establishes your baseline and identifies safety priorities.

process.title: Electrical Panel Examination
process.description: We inspect your main panel for proper sizing, recalled brands, connection quality, labeling, and signs of overheating, arcing, or moisture intrusion.

process.title: Wiring & Connection Assessment
process.description: We examine accessible wiring for damage, improper connections, outdated materials (aluminum, cloth-covered), and code violations.

process.title: Outlet & Switch Testing
process.description: We test outlets for proper grounding, polarity, and function. We verify GFCI outlets trip correctly and identify any missing safety protection.

process.title: Grounding System Verification
process.description: Proper grounding is essential for safety and surge protection effectiveness. We verify your grounding system meets current standards.

process.title: Written Report & Recommendations
process.description: You receive a detailed written report documenting our findings, prioritized recommendations, and honest assessment of urgency levels.

benefits.title: Identify Hidden Hazards
benefits.description: Electrical fires often start behind walls where you can't see problems developing. Professional inspection catches issues before they become disasters.

benefits.title: Prioritized Action Plan
benefits.description: Not everything needs immediate attention. We categorize findings by urgency—safety hazards vs. code updates vs. future improvements—so you can budget accordingly.

benefits.title: Insurance Documentation
benefits.description: Our detailed inspection reports satisfy insurance company requirements and provide documentation for claims, home sales, or peace of mind.

benefits.title: Informed Decision Making
benefits.description: Whether buying, selling, or maintaining your home, understanding your electrical system's condition empowers better decisions about repairs and upgrades.

faqs.question: What does an electrical safety inspection include?
faqs.answer: Our comprehensive inspection covers your electrical panel (capacity, connections, recalls), visible wiring (condition, materials, code compliance), outlets and switches (grounding, polarity, GFCI function), grounding system, and any areas of concern you've noticed. You receive a detailed written report with findings and recommendations.

faqs.question: How long does an electrical inspection take?
faqs.answer: A thorough residential inspection typically takes 1-2 hours depending on home size and complexity. We don't rush—proper inspection requires methodical examination. You'll receive your written report within 24-48 hours.

faqs.question: Is electrical inspection different from home inspection?
faqs.answer: Yes, significantly. General home inspectors check that outlets work and the panel has no obvious problems—a 5-10 minute electrical review. Professional electrical inspections involve detailed examination by licensed electricians who understand code requirements, hidden hazards, and system integrity.

faqs.question: Will you test outlets behind furniture?
faqs.answer: We test all reasonably accessible outlets. We can move light furniture, but we won't disassemble rooms. Let us know about any outlets you've had concerns with so we can prioritize those locations.

faqs.question: What if you find serious problems?
faqs.answer: If we identify immediate safety hazards (active fire risks, shock hazards), we'll explain the situation clearly and recommend shutting off affected circuits until repairs are made. For less urgent issues, we'll include them in your prioritized report so you can plan repairs on your timeline.

faqs.question: Do you do inspections for insurance companies?
faqs.answer: Yes. We provide electrical inspections that satisfy insurance company requirements, including 4-point inspections frequently required for homes over 30 years old. Our reports include the documentation insurers need to assess or renew coverage.

faqs.question: Can you inspect before I buy a home?
faqs.answer: Pre-purchase electrical inspections are one of our most important services. General home inspections miss significant electrical issues. Before committing to a major purchase, understand exactly what electrical work you'll need—often saving negotiations money or avoiding costly surprises.

faqs.question: What are common problems you find?
faqs.answer: Common issues include double-tapped breakers, missing GFCI protection, ungrounded outlets, recalled panel brands (Federal Pacific, Zinsco), improper DIY wiring, undersized circuits for modern loads, and degraded aluminum wiring connections. Most aren't immediately dangerous but should be addressed.

seoContent.heading: Electrical Safety Inspections in Miami & South Florida
seoContent.body: Nearly 47,000 home electrical fires occur annually in the United States—many caused by problems that a professional inspection would have caught. Solomon Electric provides comprehensive electrical safety inspections throughout South Florida, helping homeowners identify hidden hazards before they cause fires, shocks, or expensive damage. Our licensed electricians examine every aspect of your electrical system.

seoContent.heading: Beyond the General Home Inspection
seoContent.body: When you buy a home, the general inspector spends maybe 10 minutes on electrical—checking that lights work and the panel looks okay. A dedicated electrical inspection goes far deeper: examining connection quality, testing outlet grounding, verifying GFCI function, identifying recalled equipment, and assessing wiring condition. If you're buying a home over 25 years old, electrical inspection isn't optional—it's essential.

seoContent.heading: Insurance & Certification Inspections
seoContent.body: Many Florida insurance companies require electrical inspections for older homes, particularly for 4-point inspections. Some insurers won't cover homes with certain panel brands (Federal Pacific, Zinsco) or require documentation that electrical systems meet current standards. Solomon Electric provides inspection reports that satisfy insurance requirements.

seoContent.heading: Honest Assessments, Prioritized Recommendations
seoContent.body: We don't create unnecessary work. Our inspection reports prioritize findings by urgency—immediate safety hazards that need prompt attention, code updates that should be addressed, and improvements to consider for the future. You'll understand what's truly important versus what's merely not up to current standards in older homes.
